Mass. Gen. Laws ch. 186 (Landlord and Te.raw_text: Mass. Gen. Laws ch. 186 (Landlord and Tenant) (general statutory framework governing landlord-tenant relations in Massachusetts).
Mass. Gen. Laws ch. 186 (Landlord and Te.proposition:
Plaintiff relies upon and cites the following representative authorities on the covenant of quiet enjoyment and related landlord obligations. Plaintiff intends to cite such authorities as support at trial and in briefing:

Statutes and Rules
- Mass. Gen. Laws ch. 186 (Landlord and Tenant) (general statutory framework governing landlord-tenant relations in Massachusetts).

Javins v. First Nat\u2019l Realty Corp.,.raw_text: Javins v. First Nat’l Realty Corp., 428 F.2d 1071 (D.C. Cir. 1970) (recognizing implied obligations in residential leases).
Javins v. First Nat\u2019l Realty Corp.,.proposition: Under Massachusetts law and the common law applicable to landlord-tenant relationships, a lease contains an implied covenant of quiet enjoyment that guarantees the tenant’s right to possession and reasonable, peaceful use and enjoyment of the leased premises without substantial interference by the landlord or others under the landlord’s control.
